title: JLT on NPR
content:
I woke this morning to my clock radio and was surprised to hear Joshua Lurie-Turrell (Typographica co-founder and fellow typophile) talking about tacos:

[http://www.npr.org/templates/story/story.php?storyId=89990576](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905125443/http:/www.npr.org/templates/story/story.php?storyId=89990576 "http://www.npr.org/templates/story/story.php?storyId=89990576")

 [‹ Youngest Little Typophile](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905125443/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44650 "Go to previous forum topic") [Harvard Business Review ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905125443/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44745 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Mark Simonson

comments.content: Wait.... He wasn’t talking about bacon?
